html:
8.17.17  1:03 pm   Do you think that we will run out of things to discover given enough time?

     no

8.17.17  1:02 pm   You've probably already been asked this plenty of times...but are you going to update your reality page soon?

     i just added 9 videos last week. that was the only thing i worked on last week.

8.17.17  12:48 pm   I was watching the Joy of Painting the other day. I don't know how familiar you are with Bob Ross' videos...

     extremely

      but his approach to creating art is just unbelievable. And insanely inspiring. In almost every painting he'll say something like "now it's time to make a big decision" then without seemingly even thinking about it he'll just paint a giant fucking tree or mountain or something right in the middle of the foreground, that takes up a huge chunk of the painting, even covering up things he's already painted in the background... and it winds up working beautifully. I know so many artists, writers, musicians etc who are so meticulous and who spend more time thinking about what they're gonna do, then they do actually doing the thing. Like when I'm writing a song... I scrutinize every single phrase.. is that the best rhythm? Should I use a different chord to harmonize this note? Should this be louder or softer, should I use this effect, etc. But if I w ere Bob Ross, I would just throw a big old wrench into the song on a whim, and make it work. ('This is your world, and in your world, notes can live wherever you want them to. Let's put this note here. That's nice. Let's put this chord here'). Do you think that you're able to approach your content in the 'Bob Ross way'?

     well the important thing to remember here is he is doing a regular scheduled TV show with firm time limits. this is one of the gorgeous things about a regular content schedule, with time limits. things get done. and after doing so many shows of exactly the same length, you become very good at knowing exactly what is gonna work in that time frame. you know exactly how much time you have to do the sky. you know exactly when you have to decide on your mountains. you know exactly when to get to the tree highlights. and exactly when you'll have a moment to tell a brief story about some crazy shit you've seen in alaska

8.17.17  12:33 pm   In your professional opinion, how much time has to pass before a period of time can be referred to as 'the good old days'? Like, today is Thursday... can I call Mon-Wed of this week 'the good old days'? Also, how much time has to pass in order to feel nostalgic? Can I feel nostalgic about something I did earlier today? 

     i think 6 months

8.17.17  2:59 am   I love your instrumentals, but the last one was from 2014, and the previous one was from 2012. Have you stopped doing them or are they yet to be released?

     i generally have arrived at the idea that it is very important for music to work together with some sort of conceptualization -- something to hold onto. such as: words, concepts, ideas, pictures, a video, characters, story, any of the above. so generally i try to include at least some of those things. but i actually almost forgot i have another page on this site where i have done a lot of instrumental music since then. but i suppose that page does have something of a 'game' to conceptually latch onto, although the game might only be relevant to musicians, which is why it is not featured prominantly in the site

8.17.17  1:50 am   Are there any bad questions?

     i don't know how to tell

8.17.17  1:10 am   Why don't people put two spaces after a period anymore?  

     a lot of sites don't allow it

8.17.17  12:20 am   what do you feel is more important: the end product, or the journey to make it?

     which product

8.16.17  11:56 pm   do you ever hear music that doesn't make sense to you?

     in music you can do whatever you want. that's why it's so much fun. so that makes sense

8.16.17  11:49 pm   I'm really curious to know your recent discovered techniques on how to write a section that goes before a already written section!

     i don't really have any fast techniques. usually it just involves asking a lot of questions and using process of elimination to eventually narrow it down. you have to be patient, it can take a while. but in the past few years i've succeeded at it enough times that i am confident that the answer is always there if you wait for it. some examples of questions you might want to be asking, let's say for example you have your chorus and now you're trying to figure out what the verse figure is that comes before it, examples of questions would be-- does it want the same chord for or different chord form? in many songs it is a no brainer that the verse and chorus use the same form, and that's fine. some songs it is supposed to be different. so first we want to narrow it down and see which one feels right for this song. often you get a clear answer yes or no. just a lot of narrowing it down. another thing which SOMETIMES works is see what goes well AFTER the chorus, like see what would be good for a second verse. but you're still going to be left with the puzzle of what will do best as the first verse, especially if the first verse starts the song. i have no good tricks for this, just spend time narrowing it down and trying things and seeing if they work. and i've gotten this now enough times that i always know there is a solution, so i know to be patient with it and keep asking questions

8.16.17  7:56 pm   Why are men's shirt buttons on the right and women's shirt buttons on the left?

     the rumour i have heard is that traditionally men would button women's shirts for them. that is what i've heard, although i'm not sure if it's true

8.16.17  7:01 pm   can you explain the symbolism of the cats discussing  restructuring the fabric of the known universe in the music video for i wanna be a movie star

     sure. i had that sign with the lyric on it "everyone wants more than just a friend" and also no zoom/twist, and i was concerned that it was a weak spot in the video, so i needed to put something there. the line is kind of corny/mushy -- not necessarily a bad thing, but i just needed to add something visually to spice it up. and i couldn't really think of anything that would exactly represent the line, becaues the line itself is sort of ambiguous "more than just a friend" could mean different things. so there was no obvious choice for what to put visually to match that. so i was willing to think abstractly, and wanted to do something crazy to distract from it being a dull moment, as i said. a cat seemed nice. and then i just decided to put them all circling the screen because i thought that would be an interesting effect. then i thought of putting a thought bubble and then i thought of something to put in it. overall i think it was a good solution, and that moment is now much more interesting than it was without the cats. to prove it, i cite the fact that you are interested

8.16.17  6:43 pm   Do you believe in life?

     oh hell yeah

8.16.17  6:17 pm   are you ever going to add anything more to improv or is that page basically 'complete' for you

     it's barely started. the project was cut way short. i built the entire reality/improv sections during feb-may, 2016 (right after the release of history of japan) and the whole project just dragged on and on for so long, and i was 3 months into it and no 'real' videos had come out on the main channel(s) so i was desperate to get out of the project as soon as possible. i barely even got started on the improv page

8.16.17  3:26 pm   i want to be immortal, i want to be remembered. i am so fucking afraid of oblivion, just this fear's size and dimension scares the shit out of me. i want to do something to create a revolution, i want to change the world but it's not enough. i am never enough. i'm gonna lose my mind. i have to do something to leave a mark but i don't know where to start and i am the only obstacle. to be real, to prove i existed, i need to do, just do, but i only dream and waste time and i never "do". i have to start all over again. i have to do something original and perfect but i can never satisfy myself, so i still wait to be ready for the moment i'll finally decide to do. is this relatable for you?

     yes

8.16.17  3:10 pm   i don't know what i'm gonna do. there's so much to do, so many dreams, so many goals, so many things to live in this limited life, so many thoughts and i feel like my head is gonna explode and i feel too much. tick tock, time is running out and i just lost another second to begin the change i want to make. i've been waiting my whole life for to start in a cocoon. everything i've learned was for that moment. it has been years but why am i still waiting? why don't i begin? why can't i just do it?

     because you haven't defined it clearly enough, or you haven't defined the first/next step clearly enough

8.16.17  12:44 pm   I've heard different artists/musicians/writers say different things about this... just curious what your thoughts are... Do you have an overarching concept or vision that guides your work? Zappa called this 'conceptual continuity' and it was a huge aspect to his music. I've also noticed this a lot in Prince's music (a lot of songs are self-referential or reference other songs, and there's certain little recurring rhythmic patterns that he uses, and certain ideas, like sexuality and spirituality, get revisited often). Dwayne Thomas Jr., a great bass player, takes it a step further and says that you should write down your own artistic vision and read it daily... So do you have your own, specific vision or 'conceptual continuity'? It doesn't have to be something that is clearly evident to fans, but just something in your own mind that your working towards, or kind of ties everything together for you?

     there wasn't, until i realized that in a finite life-time i had better start acknowledging one. in other words, it is tempting to want to do a million different types of things under different names and be the best everything separately, but at a certain point i realized that in just 1 lifetime it's going to be much better if i just admit that i'm just one person. which was the kind of breakthrough that led to me getting a site, settling on one name, and adopting a "more is more" strategy of choosing which things to put on the site

8.16.17  12:15 pm   why does the word podcast confuse you?
